repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body: @lewis6991 do we have an established preference between using `@nodoc` and pre-fixing with an underscore?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2136,7 +2136,7 @@ end
 ---@param end_line integer
 ---@param position_encoding 'utf-8'|'utf-16'|'utf-32'
 ---@return lsp.Range
-local function make_line_range_params(bufnr, start_line, end_line, position_encoding)
+function M._make_line_range_params(bufnr, start_line, end_line, position_encoding)

comment_data.body: It the function is already `@private` then I would skip the deprecation and just remove it entirely.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2203,6 +2203,7 @@ end
 ---@field client_id? integer Client ID to refresh (default: all clients)
 ---@field handler? lsp.Handler
 
+---@deprecated
 ---@private

comment_data.body:
I would just use underscore here, without `@nodoc`. `@nodoc` is mostly useful to suppress docgen of elements for various reasons. Using underscore automatically implies `@nodoc`.

I need to write this down and fix all the places we use `@nodoc`, `@private` and underscore.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2136,7 +2136,7 @@ end
 ---@param end_line integer
 ---@param position_encoding 'utf-8'|'utf-16'|'utf-32'
 ---@return lsp.Range
-local function make_line_range_params(bufnr, start_line, end_line, position_encoding)
+function M._make_line_range_params(bufnr, start_line, end_line, position_encoding)

comment_data.body: No need to annotate local functions with `@private`, they're by default.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -85,6 +85,33 @@ function M.on_inlayhint(err, result, ctx)
   api.nvim__redraw({ buf = bufnr, valid = true, flush = false })
 end
 
+--- Refresh inlay hints, only if we have attached clients that support it
+---@param bufnr (integer) Buffer handle, or 0 for current
+---@param client_id? (integer) Client ID, or nil for all
+---@private

@@ -85,6 +85,33 @@ function M.on_inlayhint(err, result, ctx)
   api.nvim__redraw({ buf = bufnr, valid = true, flush = false })
 end
 
+--- Refresh inlay hints, only if we have attached clients that support it
+---@param bufnr (integer) Buffer handle, or 0 for current
+---@param client_id? (integer) Client ID, or nil for all
+---@private
+local function _refresh(bufnr, client_id)

comment_data.body: Might be a good idea to add a filter option to `vim.lsp.buf_request_all` that's passed to the call of `vim.lsp.get_clients`. WDYT @lewis6991?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -85,6 +85,33 @@ function M.on_inlayhint(err, result, ctx)
   api.nvim__redraw({ buf = bufnr, valid = true, flush = false })
 end
 
+--- Refresh inlay hints, only if we have attached clients that support it
+---@param bufnr (integer) Buffer handle, or 0 for current
+---@param client_id? (integer) Client ID, or nil for all
+---@private
+local function _refresh(bufnr, client_id)
+  for _, client in
+    ipairs(vim.lsp.get_clients({
+      bufnr = bufnr,
+      id = client_id,
+      method = ms.textDocument_inlayHint,
+    }))
+  do
+    for _, winid in ipairs(api.nvim_list_bufs()) do
+      if api.nvim_win_get_buf(winid) == bufnr then
+        local first = vim.fn.line('w0', winid)
+        local last = vim.fn.line('w$', winid)
+        ---@type lsp.InlayHintParams
+        local params = {
+          textDocument = util.make_text_document_params(bufnr),
+          range = util._make_line_range_params(bufnr, first - 1, last - 1, client.offset_encoding),
+        }
+        client:request(ms.textDocument_inlayHint, params, M.on_inlayhint, bufnr)

comment_data.body: I'm personally not a fan of `buf_request_all()`, this code looks fine as it is.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -85,6 +85,33 @@ function M.on_inlayhint(err, result, ctx)
   api.nvim__redraw({ buf = bufnr, valid = true, flush = false })
 end
 
+--- Refresh inlay hints, only if we have attached clients that support it
+---@param bufnr (integer) Buffer handle, or 0 for current
+---@param client_id? (integer) Client ID, or nil for all
+---@private
+local function _refresh(bufnr, client_id)
+  for _, client in
+    ipairs(vim.lsp.get_clients({
+      bufnr = bufnr,
+      id = client_id,
+      method = ms.textDocument_inlayHint,
+    }))
+  do
+    for _, winid in ipairs(api.nvim_list_bufs()) do
+      if api.nvim_win_get_buf(winid) == bufnr then
+        local first = vim.fn.line('w0', winid)
+        local last = vim.fn.line('w$', winid)
+        ---@type lsp.InlayHintParams
+        local params = {
+          textDocument = util.make_text_document_params(bufnr),
+          range = util._make_line_range_params(bufnr, first - 1, last - 1, client.offset_encoding),
+        }
+        client:request(ms.textDocument_inlayHint, params, M.on_inlayhint, bufnr)

comment_data.body: Gotcha. The nice thing about `buf_request_all` is that it handles the request cancellation which will be needed in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/31206, but not a blocker.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -85,6 +85,33 @@ function M.on_inlayhint(err, result, ctx)
   api.nvim__redraw({ buf = bufnr, valid = true, flush = false })
 end
 
+--- Refresh inlay hints, only if we have attached clients that support it
+---@param bufnr (integer) Buffer handle, or 0 for current
+---@param client_id? (integer) Client ID, or nil for all
+---@private
+local function _refresh(bufnr, client_id)
+  for _, client in
+    ipairs(vim.lsp.get_clients({
+      bufnr = bufnr,
+      id = client_id,
+      method = ms.textDocument_inlayHint,
+    }))
+  do
+    for _, winid in ipairs(api.nvim_list_bufs()) do
+      if api.nvim_win_get_buf(winid) == bufnr then
+        local first = vim.fn.line('w0', winid)
+        local last = vim.fn.line('w$', winid)
+        ---@type lsp.InlayHintParams
+        local params = {
+          textDocument = util.make_text_document_params(bufnr),
+          range = util._make_line_range_params(bufnr, first - 1, last - 1, client.offset_encoding),
+        }
+        client:request(ms.textDocument_inlayHint, params, M.on_inlayhint, bufnr)

comment_regular_data.body: The test failure led me to discover a bug fixed in  https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/25194 . Considering that `lsp.Range` is used not only by inlay hints, it might be necessary to expose `make_line_range_params` to prepare for other features that may use lsp.Range.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

labels.description: changes that are not features or bugfixes
labels.name: refactor

title: refactor(lsp): deprecate vim.lsp.util._refresh()
